src:
「唐津くんち」で曳山１４台勢ぞろい

04 Nov 2019, 00:48

唐津くんちの動画はこちら


唐津くんちの「お旅所神幸」で、曳山を運び込む曳き子たち（３日午後、佐賀県唐津市で）＝秋月正樹撮影

　国連教育・科学・文化機関（ユネスコ）の無形文化遺産、佐賀県唐津市の「唐津くんち」は３日、最大の見せ場となる「お旅所神幸（たびしょしんこう）」が行われ、１４台の曳山（やま）が勢ぞろいした。
　祭りは２日夜の「宵曳山」で始まり、３日は１番曳山・赤獅子を先頭に、鯛（たい）や鯱（しゃち）などの曳山が市中心部を巡行。クライマックスのお旅所では、車輪が砂地に埋まった重さ２～３トンの曳山を、綱を持った曳（ひ）き子たちが「エンヤー」「ヨイサー」の声を上げながら進めた。
　最終日の４日は、１４台が市中心部を巡る。
text:
At Karatsu-kunchi, there are 14 sets of Mt.

04 Nov 2019, 00:48

Click here for a video of Karatsu-kunchi


Karaki-kun's “Oshojo Shinyuki”, the lions who bring Mt. Ulsan (in the afternoon of 3rd in Karatsu City, Saga Prefecture) by Masaki Akizuki

The intangible cultural heritage of the United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO), “Karatsu Kunchi” in Karatsu City, Saga Prefecture, will be held on the 3rd, with the “Travel Shrine”, 14 units No Yamayama has gathered.
The festival begins on the evening of “Naksan” on the 2nd of the night, and on the 3rd, Naksan such as Tai and Shachi travels around the city center, starting with No. 1 Kashiyama and Akashi. At the climax depot, two to three tons of weight, whose wheels were buried in sandy ground, were held by the hiking children with leashes with the voices of “Enya” and “Yoyser”.
On the 4th day of the final day, 14 cars travel around the city centre.
